result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal 4th+)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marla L Milde

records.addlTxt: Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 7 Judicial Vacancy, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).

Hearing on November 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Hearing on November 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.

10:37 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant Marla L Milde in court with attorney Stephen P. Rypel.  Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Gordon notes she received an email from Atty. Boese and she would like to appear on this matter, but is stuck in another court.  Court will pass the matter to allow Atty. Boese to appear.  Court takes a break at 10:37 a.m.  Case recalled at 11:33 a.m.; all appearances remain the same but now Atty. Leslie Boese appears for the State of WI.  Court notes the matter is before the Court to address setting new trial dates based on the State's request to adjourn the July 19th trial date in 21CF826.  Atty. Boese first notes an amended complaint was filed in this case which needs to be addressed.  Atty. Rypel acknowledges receipt, waives reading and enters initial not guilty plea.  Atty. Boese confirms it was her request to reschedule the trial, parties were attempting to set new dates by email but there was unable to find one before November so the matter was set for status before the Court.  Based on DA participating in another trial for a homicide case the Court will agree to set the new trial date in November as requested by counsel.  Court will tag this matter along with 21CF826 for status.  Hearing scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Hearing scheduled for November 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Hearing on July 13, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Hearing on July 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.

09:01 AM; Case called for Plea/sentencing hearing.  Defendant Marla L Milde in court with attorney Stephen P. Rypel.  Alyssa Marilee Jay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court inquires how the matter will be proceeding today.  Atty. Rypel advises that he is not prepared to proceed to plea and sentencing today.  Atty. Rypel advises that there may be a new OWI charge coming and was not sure if the Court wanted to wait for that filing before proceeding on these matters.  Court notes based on the age of 21CF826 it will have to be set for trial.  Court will set this matter for status to tag along with 21CF826 with was set for jury trial.  Hearing scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 10:30 am.  Hearing scheduled for July 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Marla L Milde
Current: 424 N. Grandview, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States  (Effective: 05-17-2022)
Prior: 515 W. Moreland Blvd., c/o Waukesha County Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States

ADDRESS INFO for Marla L Milde
Current: 515 W. Moreland Blvd., c/o Waukesha County Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States  (Effective: 05-12-2022)
Prior: 424 N Grandview Blvd, Waukesha, WI 53188
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 2, 2022 at 09:00 am.

11:15 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant Marla L Milde in court with attorney Stephen P. Rypel.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court notes the matter is tagging along with 21cf826 to address WCS non-compliance.  Atty. Rypel requests a plea and sentencing date at the end of May or beginning of June.  Court adjourns for plea and sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 2, 2022 at 09:00 am.

11:52 AM Defendant Marla L Milde in court with attorney Stephen P. Rypel.  Chelsea Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office.
Atty Rypel requests to waive preliminary hearing in this matter. 
State files information. 
Defense accepts filing of the information, wavies reading and enters not guilty pleas. 
Court conducts a colloquy with defendant as to waiver of preliminary hearing. 
   Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.
Court finds the defendant knowlingly and freely waived right to preliminary hearing. 
 Bail as fixed.  Preliminary hearing waived, bound over. 
  Hearing scheduled for May 12, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Comply with all licensing restrictions.

08:56 AM Defendant Marla L Milde in court.  Andrew Nesheim appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Court notes Attorney Rypel is Court appointed on the defendants other cases.  The Court will extend the appointment of Attorney Stephen Rypel to this case.  Court sets matter for a status date before the trial court and if matter needs to be set for a preliminary hearing date, it may be set back before Commissioner Court.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for March 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.
